identificationModule.briefTitle: Testing an Evidence-Based Program for Clinician Burnout
identificationModule.officialTitle: Testing an Evidence-Based Program for Physician and Nurse Burnout

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of this clinical trial is to pilot test an app-based mindfulness training program in reducing burnout in physicians and nurses.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The main question\[s\] it aims to answer are:

PRIMARY AIM: Determine if the app-based training reduces the level of cynicism (i.e., one of the two main dimensions of burnout).

SECONDARY AIM: Determine if the app-based training reduces the level of emotional exhaustion (i.e. one of the two main dimensions of burnout), anxiety, worry, depression and intolerance of uncertainty. Determine if the app-based training increases self-compassion, non-reactivity and non-judging about inner experiences.

Participants will be asked to:

* Use an app-based mindfulness training program
* Complete online surveys at baseline, immediately post-intervention and 1 month after the post-intervention as follow up

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: 3 single groups: physicians, resident physicians and nurses

armGroups.label: Single arm
armGroups.description: Participants will be asked to utilize the app.

interventions.name: App-Delivered Mindfulness Training (MT)
interventions.description: The program is delivered via a smartphone-based platform, which includes 7 mindfulness-based modules of about 15 minutes of brief didactic and experience-based mindfulness training (audio files).

primaryOutcomes.description: The dimension of cynicism in the Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI) cynicism. The MBI is a validated 22-item self-report measure of risk of burnout. Items are rated on a 7-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (never) to 6 (every day). The investigators will use only one single-item measure of cynicism that was included from the Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The dimension of emotional exhaustion in the Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI).
secondaryOutcomes.description: The MBI is a validated 22-item self-report measure of risk of burnout. Items are rated on a 7-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (never) to 6 (every day). The investigators will use only one single-item measure of emotional exhaustion that was included from the Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: The GAD-7 is a validated 7-item measure of anxiety rated on a 4-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (Not at all sure) to 3 (Nearly every day).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire (FFMQ) non-reactivity scale.
secondaryOutcomes.description: The non-reactivity scale is a validated subscale of the 39-item FFMQ which is a self-report psychological measure of mindfulness skills. This subscale contains 7 items which are presented on a 6-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (almost always) to 6 (almost never).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire (FFMQ) non-judging scale.
secondaryOutcomes.description: The non-judging scale is a validated subscale of the 39-item FFMQ which is a self-report psychological measure of mindfulness skills. This subscale contains 8 items which are presented on a 6-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (almost always) to 6 (almost never).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: The PHQ-2 is a validated 2-item self-report measure of depression. Items are rated on a 4-point Likert scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 3 (nearly every day).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: The PSWQ is a validated 16-item self-report measure of worry with items presented on a 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (not at all typical of me) to 5 (very typical of me).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: The IUS-12 is a validated 12-item self-report measure of intolerance of uncertainty. Items are rated on a 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (not at all characteristic of me) to 5 (entirely characteristic of me).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

secondaryOutcomes.description: The SCS-SF is a validated 12-item self-report measure of self-compassion. Items are rated on a 5-point Likert scale ranging from 1 (almost never) to 5 (almost always).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: collected at baseline, immediately post-intervention and one month later as follow up

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Being a physician, resident physician or nurse
* Able to speak English because all study activities will be conducted in English.
* 18+ years
* direct patient care

Exclusion Criteria:

* If using psychotropic medication - not on a stable dosage at least 6 weeks
